poem:
"Spilled Shadows Over Dawn"

Three lay waking as daybreak unfolded,
Winds of strife tore their banner of truce.
They bearing only bare chest and innocence,
And a bright sun that saw too much.

Shot of steel, spark of death, a cruel design,
Two fell, whispering names into the dust.
Their shadows unfurling among shattered dreams
A third survives, carrying the echo, bearing the cost.

Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
